properties.name: Niotho
properties.description:
The revamped version of Chrome's offline Dino runner.

Controls :
   Computer : Up and Down arrow keys
   Touch screens : Swipe up or down

events.name: Acelerando de acordo com o piso

events.comment:
Player loses when either of these conditions is checked :
- Slimesito fell of the map
- Slimesito collided with a Platform and is under it (= the played did not duck)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.


Example uses:
- Floating objects, such as powerups or coins
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns

Properties:
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.

Example uses:
- Floating pickups
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Horizontal distance

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

events.comment: Set the center of movement to the initial location of the object
Increment counters that are used to calculate movement

eventsFunctions.description: Counter used to change the Y position of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SineProgressY

eventsFunctions.description: Counter used to change the X position of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SineProgressX

eventsFunctions.sentence: Set center X position of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Reset sine progress counters. The object will return to the initial state.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetSineCounters

propertyDescriptors.name: HorizontalSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.

Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value goes inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding
